rd.dev.simulation.custom

Class SocialClassColumn

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.control.TableColumnBase<S,T>
      • javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<SocialClass,java.lang.String>
        • rd.dev.simulation.custom.SocialClassColumn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class SocialClassColumn
extends javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<SocialClass,java.lang.String>
    A CircuitGraphicsColumn contains the additional information needed to display a switchable graphic and to select the data item for display The data items delivered to the parent TableView for display in its cells are always strings; the type conversion is handled by the Industry class. TODO parameterise SocialClass so we can re-use for other data models (eg Circuits, for which the code is almost identical

      SocialClassColumn(Commodity u)
      Produces a column to be displayed in a Industry table(TableView<Industry,String>), whose value is a Stock field referenced by a foreign key in a Industry bean.

      Produces a column to be displayed in a socialClass table(TableView<SocialClass,String>), whose value is a fixed field in a SocialClass bean that is chosen by the selector enum.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocialClassColumn

        SocialClassColumn(SocialClass.Selector selector,
                  boolean alignedLeft)
        Produces a column to be displayed in a socialClass table(TableView<SocialClass,String>), whose value is a fixed field in a SocialClass bean that is chosen by the selector enum. Use the enum to set the header text and graphic, and prepare the column header so its graphic is switchable.
        Parameters:
        selector - an enum specifying which field to display
        alignedLeft - true if the data in this column should be displayed aligned to the left (typically text fields such as commodity names or owner names)

      • SocialClassColumn

        SocialClassColumn(Commodity u)
        Produces a column to be displayed in a Industry table(TableView<Industry,String>), whose value is a Stock field referenced by a foreign key in a Industry bean. The magnitude is selected by the name of the Stock. Use Stock itself to set the header text and graphic, and prepare the column header so its graphic is switchable.
        Parameters:
        u - an enum specifying which commodity's stock to display
